text:

Another direct flight to Iceland from East Midlands Airport is being laid on after the success of a trip earlier this year to see the magical Northern Lights. 
Super Break organised a journey to city of Akureyri in February which was met by huge demand, according the company. 
So it has already started selling tickets for a second trip, which is scheduled for take-off on February 1, 2019, reports the Derby Telegraph. 
All Super Break trips to Akureyri include a Lake Myvatn Adventure – Land of Fire and Ice Tour, which includes the chance to see the region’s magical terrains, the Goddafoss Waterfall, the boiling mud pools of Namafjall and a stop at Vogafjos working farm. 
There is also the opportunity to visit Myvatn Nature Baths – the ‘Blue Lagoon of the North’ - or take part in a snowmobiling experience, for an extra charge. 
Other activities on offer include heading out on a whale-watching trip to Eeyjafjorour to observe humpback whales, harbour porpoises and dolphins. 
Alternatively, people can choose to go horse riding in the mountains or visit the Lofthellir ice cave, which is a unique lava cave filled with ice formations, stalagmites and sculptures. Read More Eight all-inclusive deals from East Midlands Airport for under £300 
Katherine Scott, from Super Break, said: “We’re incredibly proud and excited to be launching our new chartered flight programme, providing holiday-makers from the East Midlands with even more incredible travel experiences to choose from in 2018/19. 
“Following the huge demand for our exclusive flights to Akureyri, we have expanded the schedule from East Midlands Airport, helping to connect more holiday-makers to this amazing part of the world and beyond, all from their local airport.” The Northern Lights 
Rachel Briody, travel, trade and leisure development manager at East Midlands Airport, said: “We’re delighted that Super Break is adding another flight to its winter schedule from East Midlands Airport, which means holiday-makers from the region will be able to enjoy a short break in the dramatic Arctic tundra of Iceland. 
“It’s further evidence that there is growth in the East Midlands market which is great news for us and passengers who want the convenience of flying from their local airport to exciting destinations.” Read More 'No more cheap holidays' warns Ryanair chief in Brexit tirade 
Prices for the three-night trip start at £699 per person, which includes flights, accommodation and tours. This includes the Lake Myvatn Land of Fire and Ice Tour and the Search for Northern Lights Tour. 
Places can be secured with a £100 deposit. More information can be found at the Super Break website or by calling 0800 042 0288. Like us on Facebook
